Class ScalingParams

java.lang.Object
it.disi.unitn.videocreator.filtergraph.filterchain.filters.videofilters.scale.ScalingParams
public final class ScalingParams extends Object
This class implements the parameters of the scaling filter.

  • Constructor Details

    • ScalingParams

      public ScalingParams()
      This class's constructor.

    • ScalingParams

      public ScalingParams(@NotNull @NotNull ScalingAlgorithm sws_flags, @NotNull @NotNull String eval, @NotNull @NotNull String interl, @Nullable @Nullable String width, @Nullable @Nullable String height, @Nullable @Nullable String videoSizeID, @NotNull @NotNull String in_range, @NotNull @NotNull String out_range, @NotNull @NotNull String force_original_aspect_ratio, @NotNull @NotNull String inColMatrix, @NotNull @NotNull String outColorMatrix, int force_divisible_by)
      The class's constructor given pre-established scaling parameters. The given values must be compatible with the specifications given by FFMpeg.
      Parameters:
      sws_flags - The chosen scaling algorithm. This value cannot be null.
      eval - The expression to be evaluated. This value cannot be null or an empty string.
      interl - The interlacing mode. This value cannot be null or an empty string.
      width - The frame's width. This value can be null or an empty string only when the videoSizeID parameter is not null and not an empty string, and it must be set along with the height parameter.
      height - The frame's height. This value can be null or an empty string only when the videoSizeID parameter is not null and not an empty string, and it must be set along with the width parameter.
      videoSizeID - The frame's video size id. This value must be allowed by the specifications given by FFmpeg, and it can be null only when both the width and height parameters are already set.
      in_range - The input color's range.
      out_range - The output color's range.
      force_original_aspect_ratio - A parameter to force the original aspect ratio.
      inColMatrix - The input color's matrix.
      outColorMatrix - The output color's matrix.
      force_divisible_by - A parameter that, if set, forces FFmpeg to make the width and height to be divisible by it.

      public void setSwsFlags(@NotNull @NotNull ScalingAlgorithm val) throws InvalidArgumentException
      Sets the sws_flags parameter.
      Parameters:
      val - The ScalingAlgorithm instance to be used
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given ScalingAlgorithm instance is null

    • setSize

      public void setSize(boolean development, @NotNull @NotNull String width, @NotNull @NotNull String height, @NotNull @NotNull String pix_fmt) throws InvalidArgumentException, UnsupportedOperatingSystemException, MultiLanguageUnsupportedOperationException
      This method sets the width and height of the video.
      Parameters:
      development - A boolean parameter to tell the program if the user is running a custom version of FFmpeg
      width - The video's width
      height - The video's height
      pix_fmt - The video's pixel format
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the video's with or height is null or an empty string, or the given pixel format is null or an empty string
      MultiLanguageUnsupportedOperationException - If the video's size id is already set
      UnsupportedOperatingSystemException - If the user's Operating System is not yet supported by this library

    • getWidth

      public String getWidth()
      This method returns the filter's width, or an empty string if the width is null or an empty string itself.
      Returns:
      The filter's width, or an empty string if the width is null or an empty string itself

    • getHeight

      public String getHeight()
      This method returns the filter's height, or an empty string if the height is null or an empty string itself.
      Returns:
      The filter's height, or an empty string if the height is null or an empty string itself

    • setVideoSizeID

      public void setVideoSizeID(@NotNull @NotNull String videoSizeID) throws InvalidArgumentException, MultiLanguageUnsupportedOperationException
      This method sets the width and height of the resulting video by means of the given video size ID. See here for the recognized size IDs.
      Parameters:
      videoSizeID - The given video size ID
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - if the given video size ID is null or not supported by FFmpeg
      MultiLanguageUnsupportedOperationException - If the video's width and height are already set

    • getVideoSizeID

      public String getVideoSizeID()
      This method returns the filter's video size ID, or an empty string if the video size ID is null or an empty string itself.
      Returns:
      The filter's video size ID, or an empty string if the video size ID is null or an empty string itself
